comments:
An introduction to elementary particles (photons, leptons, hadrons, quarks), their interactions, and the unification of the fundamental forces.

Students felt the material was what “every student in the class plans to base his or her career on,” and students felt they “learned a lot” from the course. However, many students felt the course “moved too quickly” and “covered too much material.”

Overall, students expressed frustration with Professor Klein’s teaching methods. Students felt Professor Klein, while “knowledgeable about the subject material,” had difficulty lecturing in a clear way. Students were frustrated with Professor Klein’s projector-based lecturing, and felt Professor Klein’s attempt at teaching based on the Socratic method was “not best-suited for the material.”

Students found the final exam to be “difficult.” This course requires permission of the instructor to enroll.

*8 respondents
